content.description:
This one was cleaned and sent in approach shoes, but I suspect it still deserves a solid V0/1 grade. Super fun! 

  Start underclinging the very low lobe and use the nice jug crack to the left side and thin holds on the right until you can stand up. slab up thin holds to the top jug. Balancy and fun!
content.location: On the back side of the October Boulder. This faces the forest away from the trail. Upper Deck.

content.description:
On the left arête of the boulder and the face that points towards Persia, find the low seam that runs horizontal. At the corner is the good ledge and right crimp to stand start low on. 

  Climb up the face staying near the left arête. Use the terribly thin "potato chip" flakes to delicately ascend the face to the satisfyingly slopey top out.

The October Boulder is in a tight cluster of boulders to the left of Persia and behind/uphill a few meters from Recovery Boulder cluster. This is the boulder behind "Perfecto Boulder" 

  You will see on the downhill facing side (the face toward Persia) a seam running horizontal across the face. This is the start to "Kettle Cooked". At the back facing the forest away from the trail is the "October Slab".
